result.execSummary:
The defendant Vance W. White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation and/or extended supervision now serving.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located, except for employment purposes only, and only with his agent's approval.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

timeConds.notes:
To be completed within the first six months of probation.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CF115.

supervisions.notes:
Jail term is to be served concurrent with 14CF115 and jail credit of 104 days is granted.
Concurrent with: Jackson County case 14CF115

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Vance W. White
Current: PO Box 151, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2017)
Prior: 2215 State Road, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States

Defendant appears in custody with counsel SPD William Poss.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Counsel both received the revocatio packet.  SPD Poss states correction 14CF115 - he should have an additional 15 days of sentence credit in addition to the 104 days credit.  The 104 days is for both cases but the 15 days is only on 14CF115.  ADA Inlow agrees to the additional 15 days.  State 14CF115 - Agent recommendation of 9 months jail is approprirate; 14CF141 - 1 year jail concurrent to 14CF115.  SPD Poss states he is going to undergo additional counseling per his agent and he's been very proactive; has employment and housing arranged; received 3 certificates in the Reformers Program while in jail.  Reqeust 6 months jail on 14CF115 and 6 months jail on 15CF141 concurrent to 14CF115 with credit for 119 days served.  Defendant speaks.  Court will accept State's recommendation and orders:  14CF115 - 9 months jail, 119 days credit; 14CF141 - 1 year concurrent to 14CF115 with 104 days credit.  Electronic monitoring is up to the jail.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 11-25-2015 10:15 am
Sent copies of the ROAW to Judge to review and to schedule
With Revocation Summary (sent all paperwork to Judge)
From DOC with revocation paperwork
of JOC.  RTS.  Not deliverable as addressed.  UTF

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Defendant plead guilty to count 1 as charged.  Also plead guilty to Count 2 in 14CF115.  All other counts in those 2 cases dismissed and read in, as well as case no. 14CF16.  Court reviewed plea questionnaire, constitutional rights waived and element of the crime.  Priors confirmed.  Voting and firearm warnings given.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.  Court finds that the defendant freely voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Find guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation, concurrent with any ES/probation now serving.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 3 years probation concurrent.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located, except for employment purposes only, and only with his agent's approval.   80 hours CS within 1st 6 months of probation.   Seek and maintain employment.  CC.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Any credit to be determined and stipulated to between the parties.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
DA Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video.
